description.narrative: Contribute to saving lives and mitigating against the impact of COVID-19; contribute to saving lives and reduce the impact of the pandemic by addressing the gaps in the national health system

From the beginning of February 2021, Palestine has seen a rapid escalation of COVID-19 cases, which the authorities have labeled as the start of the third wave of infection. The public hospitals are struggling to manage the influx of severe patients in need of intensive care. While PRCS has already started initiatives to support the health authorities to expand homebased care under which patients will be provided with oxygen concentrators and pulse oxymeters if needed, thus helping the authorities addresses the gaps. PRCS /Al-Bireh branch and Al-Bireh Municipality, in consultation with PRCS HQ, have agreed to establish a COVID-19 Field Hospital in an urban setting to support the MOH in managing the overflow of COVID-19 inpatients from MOH facilities. The Field Hospital will be located in a municipality-owned, multipurpose event center in the city of Al-Bireh, in Ramallah and Al Bireh Governorate. It will start rendering services initially with 54 beds, including four for ICU1 and have ten nurses and six doctors as well as support staff (cleaners, clerks, etc.).
Palestinian Red Crescent Society and Netherlands Red Cross Society
